title: Implement main run command orchestration loop
description:
Update cmd/run.go to orchestrate the full workflow:
1. Get ready beads (with --limit and --bead filters)
2. For each bead:
   a. Create branch: bead/<bead-id>
   b. Run Claude with bead prompt
   c. If changes: commit, push, create PR, merge PR
   d. Close bead with reason
   e. Cleanup branch
3. Stop on first error

Flags:
- --branch, -b: target branch (default: main)
- --bead: specific bead ID only
- --limit, -n: max beads to process
- --dry-run: show plan without executing
- --no-merge: create PRs but don't merge

Acceptance criteria:
- Full workflow executes for a single bead
- --dry-run shows plan without side effects
- Stops immediately on error
close_reason: Implemented full orchestration loop in cmd/run.go with --branch, --bead, --limit, --dry-run, and --no-merge flags. Workflow: create branch, run Claude, check commits, push, close bead, create PR, merge.

title: Implement git branch and commit operations
description:

- HasChanges() bool - check for uncommitted changes

- Push(branch string) - push to origin
- Checkout(branch string) - switch branches
- DeleteBranch(branch string) - cleanup after merge
- GetCurrentBranch() string - get current branch name

Acceptance criteria:
- All git operations work via exec.Command
- Proper error handling for git failures
close_reason: Implemented streamlined git operations (GetCurrentBranch, Checkout, DeleteBranch, Push). Removed CreateBranch, CommitAll, HasChanges since Claude Code handles those per CLAUDE.md workflow.
